content: Talal Halabi, P.Eng., Ph.D.Search this siteEmbedded FilesSkip to main contentSkip to navigationProfesseur agrégéDépartement d'informatiqueUniversité Lavaltalal.halabi@ift.ulaval.ca    LinkedInResearch InterestsCyber Security Network SecurityCPS/IoT SecurityAnomaly DetectionGame TheoryArtificial IntelligenceNSERC Subject Codes2508 Communications Networks2700 Information Technology2715 Optimization2960 Mathematical ModellingShort BioI am a Associate Professor at the Department of Computer Science and Software Engineering at Laval University, Québec, Canada. I have a PhD in Computer Engineering from Polytechnique Montréal (University of Montreal). I am currently leading several high-impact research projects in Cybersecurity. My research focuses on the security and resilience of large-scale networked systems and adopts a rigorous approach to strategic defense through the lens of Artificial Intelligence. My goal is to increase the tolerance of these systems to zero-day threats. I have published peer-reviewed research papers extensively and fostered intensive collaborations with several universities in Canada including McGill, Queen's, Calgary, and Polytechnique Montréal.  Check out my recent publications on Google Scholar.Prospective StudentsLooking for qualified PhD students interested in IoT systems and networks security.
